title: Feature Request: Tree branch to exclude from search
author: DExUS5
body_snippet:
Hi,

the app is great, I dont know where it was my whole life.

It would be great to have ability to right click on "folder" tree node and exclude it from the search.
It could be grayed out, or with some other icon (crossed out magnifier).

iterations.description: Allowing users to exclude specific tree branches from search results is a reasonable UX enhancement that fits naturally into the existing IModelFilter-based search architecture.

comments.author: DExUS5
comments.snippet: There are several environments that I am working with, and host names are similar , when searching it's a bit problematic to distinguish in which node I am, (there are about 400+ hosts in each environment).

comments.author: Kvarkas
comments.snippet:

Also in Fenix version i am planing to add profiles that allow you to create your personal connection tree, that will include not only one source, so you may have some local settings, some from DB (even from few dbs!) and using tags you may set some a...

notes:
AI triage (claude): Allowing users to exclude specific tree branches from search results is a reasonable UX enhancement that fits naturally into the existing IModelFilter-based search architecture.
Approach: Add an ExcludeFromSearch bool property to ContainerInfo; modify ConnectionTreeSearchTextFilter to skip nodes whose ancestor containers have that flag set; expose a right-click context menu toggle; persist the flag in the XML serializer/deserializer.
